summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to FBI personnel, transmitting investigative reports from the Palm Beach Police Department concerning activities from 2001-2004 and coordinating logistics for travel related to the investigation.

persons.name: Sgt.
persons.context: Identified as the Palm Beach Police Department contact to reach out to regarding the attached reports; his work and personal phone numbers are provided.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, transmitting Palm Beach Police reports concerning activities from 2001-2004 and coordinating travel logistics with FBI personnel.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is providing FBI personnel with contact information for Sgt. at the Palm Beach Police Department to assist with the investigation.

events.title: Activities documented in Palm Beach Police reports
events.description: The first four pages of the attached report concern activities in 2001-2002.

events.title: Ongoing investigative reports
events.description: Reports with similar reference numbers through 2004 are included for context.

events.title: Planned travel for investigation
events.description: FBI personnel are working out logistics to travel tomorrow morning, presumably to follow up on the Palm Beach Police reports.

keyFacts: The document is an email from a federal prosecutor transmitting Palm Beach Police Department reports related to the Epstein investigation.
The reports concern activities spanning 2001 to 2004, indicating a focus on that time period.
The email coordinates travel for FBI personnel to presumably follow up on the information in the reports.
A specific Palm Beach Police Sergeant is identified as the primary contact for the investigation.
